Martin Brody.Action: Plays along with Ellen's playful accent teasing, showing lightheartedness and engagement with his family.
Wakes up, immediately interacts with wife and attends to feeding dogs and checking on kids.
Gets up promptly when awakened by sunlight and radio, attends to household routine by feeding the dogs, shows awareness of family whereabouts.
Engages in light-hearted banter about local accent but remains focused on immediate responsibilities.
Teasing Ellen about burning another kettle, showing playful concern about fire hazard.
Jokingly remembers rough experiences with old clothes before deciding to ship them off.
Shows concern for son's injury and gently reminds about safety.
Plays along with Ellen's compliment about his new glasses.
Immediately notices the burnt-out kettle and comments on repeated safety hazard, showing awareness of household risks.
Remembers and dismisses old 'city clothes' associated with unsafe experiences; decides to ship them off without hesitation.
Admonishes his son for playing carelessly, showing attentiveness and concern for safety.
Relies on Ellen to remind him of important items (glasses), which suggests some absentmindedness.

Jokes lightly with Ellen ('Here? You gotta be kiddin'') displaying casual friendliness and ease in interaction.
